#S2155 exempts many banks from a living will mandate, which outlines a plan for an orderly resolution in the event of a big bank’s failure and ensures its failure doesn’t destabilize the financial system.

S. 2155 will allow some 85% of depository institutions to avoid public reporting on their mortgage lending activities. 

This reporting is critical to identifying discrimination in banking against Black Americans, Latinos, and other minority groups.
